member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.ILearnTestObjectsProvider.LearnChildObjects(HP.LFT.SDK.ITestObject)
member.summary: Learns all child objects of the parentTestObject, and returns the result in a form of a Tree. Please note that the root of the tree is always a top level object (such as browser or window). If the parentTestObject is not a top level object, the tree will include all of its parents and its children (no brothers though).
member.param: the test object to learn child objects of.

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.ISupportsNativeObject.NativeObject
member.summary: Returns the native application object that is represented by this test object instance, enabling you to access the native properties and methods provided by that object.
member.remarks:
You can retrieve the list of available native operations for an object using the nativeObject.MEMBERS property.
For implementation details and important considerations, see the NativeObject property topic in the LeanFT Help Center.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.ITestObject.VerifyImageExists(System.Drawing.Image,System.Byte)
member.summary: Checks whether a snapshot of this object contains the supplied image.
member.remarks: When this method returns a false value, the step fails, but the failure does not throw an exception or cause the test to stop running.
member.param: The image to look for within the test object's snapshot.
Optional. The minimum similarity between the two images (as a percentage), above which the find is considered a match. Default = 100.
member.returns: the Point where the image was located, or null if it was not found.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.ITestObject.VerifyImageMatch(System.Drawing.Image,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Checks whether a snapshot of this object and the supplied image are a match, given the specified pixel and RGB tolerance values.
member.remarks: When this method returns a false value, the step fails, but the failure does not throw an exception or cause the test to stop running.
member.param: The image to compare to the test object snapshot.
Optional. The percentage of pixels that can differ between the two images, and still be considered a match. Default = 0.
Optional. The percent by which the RGB values of the pixels in the two images can differ, and still be considered a match. Default = 0.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.ITestObject.VerifyImageMatch(System.Drawing.Image,HP.LFT.SDK.Utils.ImageMaskArea,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Checks whether the defined mask areas within the object snapshot and the supplied image match, given the specified pixel and RGB tolerance values.
member.remarks:
Returns true only if the mask areas match and the two full images are the same size.
When this method returns a false value, the step fails, but the failure does not throw an exception or cause the test to stop running.
member.param: The image to compare to the test object snapshot.
The mask area within the two images to use for the comparison.
Optional. The percentage of pixels that can differ between the two images, and still be considered a match. Default = 0.
Optional. The percent by which the RGB values of the pixels in the two images can differ, and still be considered a match. Default = 0.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.TE.IScreenBase.Sync(System.Int64)
member.summary: Waits until a response is received from the host and the emulator status is set to Ready, or until the timeout is reached, before continuing with the run session.
member.param: The amount of time for which the session waits after a response.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.TE.IScreenBase.Sync
M:HP.LFT.SDK.TE.IScreenBase.WaitForText(HP.LFT.SDK.StringProperty,HP.LFT.SDK.TE.Area,System.Int64)
member.summary:
Waits for a specified text to appear on the emulator screen before continuing the run session.
Example 1: This example uses the WaitForText method to wait 10 seconds for the string defined as a regular expression, for example: "CH70001 LAST ACCESS AT 14:27:07 ON THURSDAY":
WaitForText(As.RegExp(@".*LAST ACCESS AT \d\d:\d\d:\d\d ON .*DAY.*"), new Area(3, 1, 3, 80), 10000)
Example 2: This example uses the WaitForText method to wait 5 seconds for a string, for example: "User":
WaitForText("User", new Area(3, 1, 3, 80), 5000)
member.param: The specified for which the emulator screen is waiting. This parameter could be represented as a string or a regular expression.
The where the specified text exists.
The amount of time the emulator screen waits after a response.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.TE.IScreenBase.WaitForText(HP.LFT.SDK.StringProperty,HP.LFT.SDK.TE.Area)
member.summary:
Waits for specified text to appear on the emulator screen before continuing the run session.
Ecample 1: This example uses the WaitForText method to wait 10 seconds for a string defined as a regular expression, for example: "CH70001 LAST ACCESS AT 14:27:07 ON THURSDAY":
WaitForText(As.RegExp(@".*LAST ACCESS AT \d\d:\d\d:\d\d ON .*DAY.*"), new Area(3, 1, 3, 80), 10000)
Example 2: This example uses the WaitForText method to wait 5 seconds for a string, for example: "User":
WaitForText("User", new Area(3, 1, 3, 80), 5000)
member.param: The specified for which the emulator screen is waiting. This parameter could be represented as a string or a regular expression.
The where the specified text exists.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.TE.IScreenBase.WaitForText(HP.LFT.SDK.StringProperty,System.Int64)
member.summary:
Waits for specified text to appear on the emulator screen before continuing the run session.
Example 1: This example uses the WaitForText method to wait 10 seconds for a string defined as a regular expression. for example: "CH70001 LAST ACCESS AT 14:27:07 ON THURSDAY"
WaitForText(As.RegExp(@".*LAST ACCESS AT \d\d:\d\d:\d\d ON .*DAY.*"), new Area(3, 1, 3, 80), 10000)
Example 2: This example uses the WaitForText method to wait 5 seconds for a string, for example: "User":
WaitForText("User", new Area(3, 1, 3, 80), 5000)
member.param: The specified for which the emulator screen is waiting. This parameter could be represented as a string or a regular expression.
The amount of time the emulator screen waits after a response.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.TE.IScreenBase.WaitForText(HP.LFT.SDK.StringProperty)
member.summary:
Waits for specified text to appear on the emulator screen before continuing the run session.
Example 1: This example uses the WaitForText method to wait 10 seconds for a string defined as a regular expression, for example: "CH70001 LAST ACCESS AT 14:27:07 ON THURSDAY"
WaitForText(As.RegExp(@".*LAST ACCESS AT \d\d:\d\d:\d\d ON .*DAY.*"), new Area(3, 1, 3, 80), 10000)
Example 2: This example uses the WaitForText method to wait 5 seconds for a string, for example: "User":
WaitForText("User", new Area(3, 1, 3, 80), 5000)
member.param: The specified for which the emulator screen is waiting. This parameter could be represented as a string or a regular expression.

The type of index. Default is Index.

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.Description.Vri
member.summary: Distinguishes this object from other objects with otherwise identical descriptions, based on this object's visual relationship to another object in the application.
member.remarks: For example if you have 10 identical buttons with the text label "Buy" and no other real property to distinguish between them, you can use VRI to indicate that this test object represents the "Buy" button that is located to the right of the image of a specific product. The Vri property value is a object that defines the test object you are relating to, and where that related object is located on the screen relative to the object to identify. For more details, see the LeanFT Help Center.

member.name: T:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IMenu
member.summary: A menu control in a Web page or application.

member.name: T:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IWebElement
member.summary: Base interface for Web test objects.
member.remarks: Any <div> tag can be represented as an IWebElement. Any element can be referred to as a WebElement. For example, a button can be searched for as a web element, but not vice versa.

member.name: T:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IWebTestObject
member.summary: A generic Web test object used only for implementation. Do not use to describe a concrete web test object.

member.name: T:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IWebDescriber
member.summary: Indicates that the test object supports describing its child test object with advanced web filters.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IWebDescriber.Describe``1(HP.LFT.SDK.Web.XPathDescription)
member.summary: Describes a child test object using the provided XPath.
member.remarks: The current instance test object is the parent of the returned test object. LeanFT searches for this test object only when an operation on this test object is invoked. This means that if the test object is not found in the application, this command will still succeed. In this case, an exception is thrown only when an operation is invoked.
member.param: The XPath used to find the child test object.
member.returns: The requested child test object with its description.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IWebDescriber.Describe``1(HP.LFT.SDK.Web.CSSDescription)
member.summary: Describes a child test object using the provided CSS selector.
member.remarks: The current instance test object is the parent of the returned test object. LeanFT searches for this test object only when an operation on this test object is invoked. This means that if the test object is not found in the application, this command will still succeed. In this case, an exception is thrown only when an operation is invoked.
member.param: The CSS selector query used to find the child test object.
member.returns: The requested child test object with its description.

member.name: T:HP.LFT.SDK.ILocationInfoProvider
member.summary: Indicates that a test object supports accessing properties of its location on the screen.

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.ILocationInfoProvider.Location

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.ILocationInfoProvider.AbsoluteLocation
member.summary: This object's coordinates relative to the screen (in pixels). 0,0 is the top-left corner of the (primary) monitor.

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.ILocationInfoProvider.Size
member.summary: This object's size in pixels.

member.summary: Clicks on the this object twice.

member.summary: Clicks on this object twice according to the specified behavior.
member.remarks: If you are testing a Web or hybrid mobile application on a Mobile device, this method is equivalent to performing a DoubleTap gesture.
member.param: The arguments that define the behavior of the double click operation.

member.param: The event info describing the event to trigger. The event can be any HTML DOM event.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IWebElement.LongPress
member.summary: Presses and holds this object.
member.remarks: This method is not supported in Internet Explorer.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IWebElement.LongPress(HP.LFT.SDK.Web.WebLongPressArgs)
member.summary: Presses and holds this object according to the specified behavior.
member.param: The arguments that define the behavior of the long press operation.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IWebElement.Pan(System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Performs a pan gesture on this object.
member.remarks: This method is not supported in Internet Explorer.
member.param: The distance moved on the x-axis.
The distance moved on the y-axis.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IWebElement.Pan(HP.LFT.SDK.Web.WebPanArgs)
member.summary: Performs a pan gesture on this object according to the specified behavior.
member.remarks: This method is not supported in Internet Explorer.
member.param: The arguments that define the behavior of the pan operation.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IWebElement.Pinch(System.Double)
member.summary: Performs a pinch gesture of the specified scale on this object.
member.remarks: This method is not supported in Internet Explorer.
member.param:
The zoom scale resulting from the pinch gesture. This is the ratio between the distance between the fingers at the end of the pinch gesture to the distance between the fingers at the beginning of the pinch gesture.
For example, if you were to touch a screen with your fingers 6 cm apart, and pinch until your fingers were 3 cm apart, the scale would be 0.5. Likewise, if your fingers were 3 cm apart, and you pinch until your fingers are 6 cm apart, the scale would be 2.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IWebElement.Pinch(HP.LFT.SDK.Web.WebPinchArgs)
member.summary: Performs a pinch gesture on this object according to the specified behavior.
member.param: The arguments that define the behavior of the pinch operation.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IWebElement.Swipe(HP.LFT.SDK.SwipeDirection)
member.summary: Swipes this object in the specified direction.
member.remarks: This method is not supported in Internet Explorer.
member.param: The direction of the swipe gesture. Possible values: .

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IWebElement.Swipe(HP.LFT.SDK.Web.WebSwipeArgs)
member.summary: Swipes this object according to the specified behavior.
member.param: The arguments that define the behavior of the swipe operation.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IMenu.Select(System.String)
member.summary: Selects the menu item according to the specified path.
member.param:
The path to the menu item to select, separated by semicolons, e.g. "item1;item2" or "#1;#2"
The menu items can be specified by name or index numbers (0-based).
Tip: You can use the BuildMenuPath method to build the menu path string that can then be used as the menuPath argument for this method.

member.summary: Arguments that define additional behavior for all time-based gestures.

member.summary: The location in which to perform the gesture. Possible values: . Default = center of the object.

member.name: T:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.TreeViewConfiguration
member.summary: A set of XPath values to help the object perform Select, Expand, and Collapse operations in cases where the default implementation cannot find the element needed.

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.TreeViewConfiguration.SelectXPath
member.summary: The XPath value used to find the internal tree element used to select a tree node.
member.remarks: Leave this value as a null value if the regular Select operation runs correctly.

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.TreeViewConfiguration.ExpandXPath
member.summary: The XPath value used to find the internal tree element used to expand and collapse a tree node.
member.remarks:
Leave this value as a null value if the regular Expand and Collapse methods run correctly.
If the XPath value needed for the Expand operation is different from the XPath value needed for the Collapse operation, use the object.

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.TreeViewConfiguration.ForceExpandWithDoubleClick
member.summary: When set to true, the Expand or Collapse operation uses a double click.
member.remarks: The default behavior for the tree is to first try to use a single click. If the node is not expanded with a click it will try to use double click. Setting this property will improve performance when dealing with deep paths.

member.name: T:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.ExtendedTreeViewConfiguration
member.summary: A set of XPath values to help the object perform Select, Expand, and Collapse operations when the default implementation cannot find the required tree element.
member.remarks: This class extends the by giving the option of a different XPath value for Expand and Collapse operations.

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.ExtendedTreeViewConfiguration.ExpandXPath
member.summary: The XPath value used to find the internal tree element used to expand a tree node.
member.remarks: Leave this value as a null value if the regular Select, Expand, or Collapse operations run correctly.

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.ExtendedTreeViewConfiguration.CollapseXPath
member.summary: The XPath value used to find the internal tree element used to collapse a tree node.
member.remarks: Leave this value as a null value if the regular Select, Expand, or Collapse operations run correctly.

member.name: T:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.ITreeView
member.summary: A tree control in a Web site or application.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.ITreeView.BuildNodePath(System.Object[])
member.summary: Returns the path of the specified node constructed from the parts of the path.
member.param: The parts of the path to the tree element. This can include the logical name(string), full path(comma-separated strings), or index (0-based).
member.returns: The path for the node.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.ITreeView.GetNode(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the specified node in this tree using the full path to the tree item.
member.param: The full path of the node to return within the tree, separated by semicolons.
member.returns: An object corresponding to the given path.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.ITreeView.GetNode(System.Object[])
member.summary: Returns the specified node in the tree using the path created with the parts of the path.
member.param: The parts of the tree path. This can include the logical name(string), full path(comma-separated strings), or index (0-based).
member.returns: An object corresponding to the given path.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.ITreeView.Select(HP.LFT.SDK.Web.ITreeViewNode)
member.summary: Selects the specified node in this object.

remarks.para: If the child items in this object are generated dynamically (for example, if they are not visible or present in the application until the parent node is expanded), LeanFT will not be able to select the items in the tree automatically using this method. Manually add steps to make the nodes visible or expand tree nodes to create the object in the application.

member.param: The to select in the tree.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.ITreeView.Select(System.String)
member.summary: Selects the specified node in the tree based on the path to the tree node.

remarks.para: If the child items in this object are generated dynamically (for example, if they are not visible or present in the application until the parent node is expanded), LeanFT will not be able to select the items in the tree automatically using this method. Manually add steps to make the nodes visible or expand tree nodes to create the object in the application.

member.param: The full path to the tree node to select, separated by semicolons.

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.ITreeView.SelectedNodePath
member.summary: The path of the selected node in this tree. Your application must implement the "aria-selected" property for this object to enable LeanFT to display the selected node path. If there is more than one selected node, the first node is returned.

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.ITreeView.Configuration
member.summary: A that helps run Select, Expand, or Collapse operations on nodes of this tree.
member.remarks: Only set this value if LeanFT does not locate the right object for the regular Select, Expand, or Collapse methods.

member.name: T:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.ITreeViewNode
member.summary: A single node in a Web Tree.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.ITreeViewNode.Collapse
member.summary: Collapses this tree node.
member.remarks: There may be a slight delay when using this method due to the animation of the collapse operation. You should add a Sleep statement after this step to pause for the animation.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.ITreeViewNode.Expand
member.summary: Expands this tree node.
member.remarks: There may be a slight delay when using this method due to the animation of the expand operation. You should add a Sleep statement after this step to pause for the animation.

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.ITreeViewNode.Path
member.summary: The full path of this node. You can specify multiple parts for the path to the item, separated by semicolons.

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.WPF.ICalendar.Date
member.summary: Either the date or the start date of the date range associated with this object. Note:
member.remarks:
- In case a date range is selected, the Date property will return the start date of the range.
- If you try to retrieve a date value from a WPFcalendar object (e.g. calendar.Date; calendar.Date.Month; calendar.Date.Year)before performing an operation on it, LeanFT returns an exception of type:InvalidOperationException. Therefore, make sure to precede the retrieve value step with a step that performs an operation on the calendar, such as using to set the date on the calendar to the current date.

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.WPF.ICalendar.DateRanges
member.summary: The selected date range of this Month Calendar control in multi-selection mode.
member.remarks:
If a single date is selected in the calendar:
DateRanges returns an array with a single element.
Both DateRange.StartDate and DateRange.EndDate are equal to the selected date.

member.name: T:HP.LFT.SDK.Mobile.EventResponseArgs
member.summary: Configures how to simulate events that interrupt the application flow on the device, such as an incoming call or SMS.
member.remarks: These simulated events can help you test that your application responds properly to the event itself and to state transitions. For example, you may want to verify that when an incoming SMS is received, your application is sent to the background for several seconds, and, when it returns to the foreground, the application is in an active state, ready to continue.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Mobile.EventResponseArgs.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the EventResponseArgs class with default arguments (TimeInBackground = 10 seconds; RespondToEvent = false).

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.Mobile.EventResponseArgs.TimeInBackground
member.summary: The time (in seconds) that the application remains in the background while the event is being handled. Default = 10

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.Mobile.EventResponseArgs.RespondToEvent
member.summary: Indicates whether there is a response to the simulated event. Default = false

member.name: T:HP.LFT.SDK.Mobile.IDropDown
member.summary: A drop-down object in a mobile application.

members.member:
Selects the specified item or items by index. Multiple indexes are supported only for iOS.
CODE SAMPLE NEEDED For an iOS picker wheel, you can pass an index for each wheel.
For an Android drop-down, pass only one index in the array. CODE SAMPLE NEEDED The 0-based indexes of the items to select.

Selects the specified items by name from the corresponding picker wheel's list of values. (iOS only)
CODE SAMPLE NEEDED The names of the items to select in each wheel.

Selects the specified item in the specified picker wheel by index. (iOS only)
QUESTION: Do we want to use the term component or picker or wheel? Yeal RND to change to wheel The 0-based index of the picker wheel in which to select the specified item. The 0-based index of the item to select in the specified picker wheel.

member.summary: Selects the specified item by name in the picker. (iOS only)
member.param: The 0-based index of the picker wheel in which to select the specified item.
The name of the item to select in the picker wheel.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Mobile.IEditField.SetSecure(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the encoded value of this edit box.
member.remarks:
Generate the encoded value using the Password Encoder utility, available from the LeanFT > Tools menu in your IDE or from the Windows Start menu.
Note: The SetSecure method enables you to hide passwords displayed on the screen while running or editing a LeanFT test, but it is not intended to be a secure way to protect password information.

member.returns: The locked device.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Mobile.MobileLab.TryLockDeviceByInfo(HP.LFT.SDK.Mobile.IDeviceInfo,HP.LFT.SDK.Mobile.IDevice@)
member.summary: Checks whether a device is available in the Mobile Center lab and, if so, locks it so that only the current LeanFT test can perform actions on it.
member.remarks: If this method fails, the test continues without an exception.
member.param: An interface () containing information about the device to lock.
If the method returns True, this parameter contains the locked IDevice. If the method returns False, the parameter contains a null value.
member.returns: True if the locking operation succeeded, otherwise false.

members.member:
Opens a remote access window in Mobile Center with the specified application loaded on the specified device. If the specified device is already open in a remote access window, the application launches according to the .
QUESTION: Should we say when this should be used? How does this fit into running a test silently? The device is locked as long as the remote access window is open. The ID of device to open in the remote access window. The ID of the application to launch on the specified device. The identifier of the application to launch on the specified device. The version of the application. for installing and opening the specified application. Indicates whether the application is packaged or not.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.SAP.GUI.IGuiSession.Sync(System.Int64)
member.summary: Suspends execution until the SAP GUI for Windows session is available or until timed out.
member.remarks: After time-out, the test run continues regardless of the session status. You can use this method when invoking a new session from an existing session or when moving from a session that is open on one server to a new session on a different server.
member.param: milliseconds.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.SAP.GUI.IGuiSession.Close
member.summary: Closes the SAP GUI for Windows session without displaying a warning message.
member.remarks: You can invoke this method at the end of an action or test iteration to close sessions that were opened during the test run. This ensures that each iteration begins with the same number of open SAP Gui for Windows sessions.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.SAP.GUI.IGuiSession.Reset
member.summary: Navigates to the session initial screen.
member.remarks: We recommend using this method to ensure that tests are rerun from the initial screen of the session.

member.name: T:HP.LFT.SDK.SAP.GUI.ITreeView
member.summary: A column tree, list tree, or simple tree control in a SAP GUI for Windows application.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.SAP.GUI.ITreeView.ActivateNode(System.String)
member.summary: Activates the specified node in the tree by path.
member.remarks:
Use the BuildNodePath method to build the path argument.
You can use regular expressions for elements in the path. The format is: RegExp:=(regular expression).
member.param: Nodes in the path can be specified by name or 1-based index in the format "#index".

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.SAP.GUI.ITreeView.ActivateNode(HP.LFT.SDK.SAP.GUI.ITreeViewNode)

member.name: T:HP.LFT.SDK.SAP.GUI.GuiSessionFactory
member.summary: A class for creating an instance.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.SAP.GUI.GuiSessionFactory.Launch(System.String)
member.summary: Launches the SAP Gui session on the given server description.
member.param: The server to which you want to log on. The string is case-sensitive and must be identical to the one displayed in the SAP Logon dialog box.
member.returns: The launched session

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.SAP.GUI.GuiSessionFactory.Launch(System.Net.IPAddress,System.Int32)
member.summary: Opens a connection to the specified SAP server according to its IP address
member.param: The connection IP for the SAP server to which you want to open a connection.
The server system number
member.returns: The launched session
member.exception: In case server IP is null.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.SAP.GUI.GuiSessionFactory.Launch(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Launches the SAP Gui session and perform the log-in accoroding to the specified user credentials on the specified server description.
member.remarks:
Generate the password encoded value using the Password Encoder utility (CryptonApp.exe), available from the LeanFT menu in your IDE, or from the LeanFT installation\bin folder.
Note: While the encrypted value hide passwords displayed on the screen while running or editing a LeanFT test, it is not intended to be a secure way to protect password information.
member.param: The server to which you want to log on. The string is case-sensitive and must be identical to the one displayed in the SAP Logon dialog box.
The SAP client you want to use.
The username with which you want to log on to the SAP Server.
The encrypted value of the password for the specified username.
The 2-letter code for the language you want to use.
member.returns: The launched session

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.SAP.GUI.GuiSessionFactory.Launch(System.Net.IPAddress,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Launches the SAP Gui session and perform the log-in accoroding to the specified user credentials on the specified server ip.
member.remarks:
Generate the password encoded value using the Password Encoder utility (CryptonApp.exe), available from the LeanFT menu in your IDE, or from the LeanFT installation\bin folder.
Note: While the encrypted value hide passwords displayed on the screen while running or editing a LeanFT test, it is not intended to be a secure way to protect password information.
member.param: The connection IP for the SAP server to which you want to open a connection.
The SAP client you want to use.
The username with which you want to log on to the SAP Server.
The encrypted value of the password for the specified username.
The 2-letter code for the language you want to use.
member.returns: The launched session

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.SAP.GUI.GuiSessionFactory.Attach(HP.LFT.SDK.SAP.GUI.GuiSessionDescription)
member.summary: Returns a new instance that is attached to a session that was not opened by LeanFT (for example, a session that was opened manually or by the AUT).
member.remarks:
is used only when attaching to the session so transient properties like can be used.
LeanFT recognizes SAP GUI Session and tabs that it opens (for example, via ). If a GUI Session is opened outside of the LeanFT context, you need to use the method to acquire the GUI session.
member.param: for filtering the open sessions.
member.returns: for the launched session if a single matching sessions was found.
member.exception: No open sessions matches the description.
More than one session matches the description.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.SAP.GUI.GuiSessionFactory.GetAllOpenSessions(HP.LFT.SDK.SAP.GUI.GuiSessionDescription)
member.summary: Returns the open sessions that match the description.
member.param: A containing the set of properties and values that should be common to all returned sessions.
member.returns: A collection of objects that are open and match the description.

member.summary: Sets the encoded value of this edit box.

Generate the encoded value using the Password Encoder utility, available from the LeanFT > Tools menu in your IDE or from the Windows Start menu.
Note: The SetSecure method enables you to hide passwords displayed on the screen while running or editing a LeanFT test, but it is not intended to be a secure way to protect password information.

member.summary: Selects the specified item in the menu by menu path.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.StdWin.IMenu.GetItem(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the menu item with the specified path. Tip: To check whether the item exists, use the MenuItem.Exists property.
member.param: The full path of the menu item to return. The path is composed of the menu item names or a numeric index separated by a semicolon. To specify the index of the item to select, use <Item #>. Index values begin with 1. Tip: Use the BuildMenuPath method to build the item path string to be used as the itemPath argument for this method.
member.returns: The menu item (IMenuItem) found at the specified item path

member.summary: Use this mode when you build a design-time tool using the LeanFT SDK. If an object is not immediately found, the query fails. LeanFT does not wait for the object to appear until the object synchronization timeout (20 seconds) elapses.

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IArea.Coords
member.summary:
Specifies the coordinates of an area in an image-map. The coordinate format is determined by the shape of the area, for example:
shape="rect" - x1,y1,x2,y2
shape="circle" - x,y,radius
shape="poly" - x1,y1,x2,y2,..,xn,yn

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IMediaControl.Sources
member.summary: A collection of all media file source URLs.

remarks.para: A media file may have multiple URL addresses for use in different browser types.
If the src attribute was set, but no sources were defined in the HTML, the Sources property will return a collection containing a single item with the "src" value.

member.name: T:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IBrowser
member.summary: A tab in an open Web browser.
member.remarks:
To open a new browser tab, use: .
To access a browser that is already open, use: .

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IBrowser.Back
member.summary: Navigates to the previous page in the browser history list.
member.remarks: This method is identical to clicking the browser's Back button.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IBrowser.ClearCache
member.summary: Clears the browser cache.
member.remarks: This method does not clear the browser's cookies. Use to delete the cookies.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IBrowser.Close
member.summary: Closes the browser window (or tab) that this test object represents.
member.remarks: Use the method to close the currently open tab, all sibling tabs, and the parent browser window.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IBrowser.CloseAllTabs
member.summary: Closes all tabs (if any) and closes the browser window.

remarks.para: Use the method to close only the currently open tab.

Limitation: Your Internet Explorer (IE) browser must be configured to "Always close all tabs". To do this, open two or more tabs in IE. Then close IE. In the message box that pops up, select the "Always close all tabs" option.
Note: This method is not supported on Chrome. Use the Close method instead.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IBrowser.DeleteCookies
member.summary: Deletes all cookies from the browser.
member.remarks: This method does not clear the browser's cache. Use clear the cache.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IBrowser.DeleteCookies(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes only cookies that originated from the browser source.
member.param: The full or partial domain of the source. For example, entering MySite.com or MySite.net clears cookies only from the specified site, whereas entering MySite clears cookies from all related domains.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IBrowser.EmbedScript(System.String)
member.summary: Runs this JavaScript each time a page or frame loads or refreshes in the browser.

remarks.para: - The script remains embedded until you close the browser, or until the run session ends.
- Using this method to perform alert operations may result in unexpected behavior.
- To run this method, the security settings in your Web browser must be set to allow active scripting. Otherwise, steps using this method will fail.

member.param: The full content of the JavaScript to embed.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IBrowser.Forward
member.summary: Navigates to the next page in the browser history list.
member.remarks: This method is identical to clicking the browser's Forward button.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.IBrowser.Describe``1(HP.LFT.SDK.IDescription)
member.summary: Describes a child test object.
member.remarks: The current instance test object is the parent of the returned test object. LeanFT searches for this test object only when an operation on this test object is invoked. This means that if the test object is not found in the application, this command will still succeed. In this case, an exception is thrown only when an operation is invoked.
member.param: The child test object description.
member.returns: The requested child test object with its description.

member.summary: Arguments that define additional behavior for the Pinch method.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.WebPinchArgs.#ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the WebPinchArgs class with default arguments (pinches from the center of the object in 1 seconds).
member.param: The zoom scale resulting from the pinch gesture. This number is the ratio between the distance between the fingers at the end of the pinch gesture to the distance between the fingers at the beginning of the pinch gesture. For example, if you were to touch a screen with your fingers 6 cm apart, and pinch until your fingers were 3 cm apart, the scale would be 0.5. Likewise, if your fingers were 3 cm apart, and you pinch until your fingers are 6 cm apart, the scale would be 2.

member.name: P:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.WebPinchArgs.Scale
member.summary:
The zoom scale resulting from the pinch gesture. This number is the ratio between the distance between the fingers at the end of the pinch gesture to the distance between the fingers at the beginning of the pinch gesture.
For example, if you were to touch a screen with your fingers 6 cm apart, and pinch until your fingers were 3 cm apart, the scale would be 0.5. Likewise, if your fingers were 3 cm apart, and you pinch until your fingers are 6 cm apart, the scale would be 2.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.BrowserFactory.Attach(HP.LFT.SDK.Web.BrowserDescription)
member.summary: Returns a new instance that is attached to a browser tab that was not opened by LeanFT (for example, a browser tab that was opened manually or by the AUT).
member.remarks:
is used only when attaching to the browser so transient properties like and can be used.
LeanFT recognizes browser windows and tabs that it opens (for example, via ). If a browser is opened outside of the LeanFT context, you need to use the method to acquire the browser tab or window.
Examples: - A browser tab was opened manually while setting up a scenario prior to running a LeanFT test.
- A test step clicks a link in the AUT that opens a new or replacement browser tab or window.
member.param: for filtering the open tabs.
member.returns: for the launched browser if a single matching browser was found.
member.exception: No open browser tab matches the description.
More than one browser tab matches the description.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.Web.BrowserFactory.GetAllOpenBrowsers(HP.LFT.SDK.Web.BrowserDescription)
member.summary: Returns a collection of all open that matches the .
member.remarks: The is used only when attaching to the browser so transient properties like and can be used.
member.param: to filter the opened tabs against.
member.returns: A collection of objects that are open and match the description.

member.name: T:HP.LFT.SDK.TestObjectExtensions
member.summary: Class for extension methods of the TestObject class

members.member:
CODE SAMPLE NEEDED
Waits until a certain condition is met in the specified boolean function or the timeout elapses. When a WaitUntil step runs, it passes the specified test object to the function. This method is useful for synchronizing your test with your application.
This overload uses the default object synchronization timeout. A class implementing ITestObject The test object that is passed to the funcToRun function. A function returning a boolean result. The function runs until the function result is true, or until the object synchronization timeout elapses. Boolean value returned from the funcToRun function.

member.name: M:HP.LFT.SDK.TestObjectExtensions.WaitUntil``1(``0,System.Func{``0,System.Boolean},System.Int32)
member.summary: Waits until a certain condition is met in the specified boolean function or the timeout elapses. When a WaitUntil step runs, it passes the specified test object to the function. This method is useful for synchronizing your test with your application.
member.remarks: This overload uses timeout specified in the totalTimeOutTime argument.
member.param: The test object that is passed to the funcToRun function.
A function returning a boolean result. The function runs until the function result is true, or until the specified timeout elapses.
Timeout (in milliseconds) to wait until funcToRun function becomes true.
member.returns: Boolean value returned from the funcToRun function.

member.summary: The window is in normal, restored state.

member.summary: The window is maximized.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowState.Minimized
member.summary: The window is minimized.

member.name: T:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles
member.summary: Window styles as defined in the Windows API.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_BORDER
member.summary: The window has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_CAPTION
member.summary: The window has a title bar (includes the WS_BORDER style).

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_CHILD
member.summary: The window is a child window. A window with this style cannot have a menu bar. This style cannot be used with the WS_POPUP style.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_CHILDWINDOW
member.summary: Same as the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other. That is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the WS_CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If WS_CLIPSIBLINGS is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_DISABLED
member.summary: The window is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_DLGFRAME
member.summary: The window has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_GROUP
member.summary: The window is the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the WS_GROUP style.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_HSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_ICONIC
member.summary: The window is initially minimized. Same as the WS_MINIMIZE style.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially maximized.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_MAXIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a maximize button.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_MINIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially minimized. Same as the WS_ICONIC style.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_MINIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a minimize button.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_OVERLAPPED
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the WS_TILED style.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. Same as the WS_TILEDWINDOW style.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_POPUP
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_POPUPWINDOW
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_SIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a sizing border. Same as the WS_THICKFRAME style.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_SYSMENU
member.summary: The window has a window menu on its title bar.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_TABSTOP
member.summary: The window is a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_THICKFRAME
member.summary: The window has a sizing border. Same as the WS_SIZEBOX style.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_TILED
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border. Same as the WS_OVERLAPPED style.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_TILEDWINDOW
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. Same as the WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW style.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_VISIBLE
member.summary: The window is initially visible.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowStyles.WS_VSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: T:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles
member.summary: Extended window styles as defined in the Windows API.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_ACCEPTFILES
member.summary: The window accepts drag and drop files.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_APPWINDOW
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE
member.summary: The window has a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_COMPOSITED
member.summary: Paints all descendants of a window in bottom-to-top painting order using double-buffering.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: The title bar of the window includes a question mark. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT
member.summary: The window contains child windows that take part in dialog box navigation.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME
member.summary: The window has a double border.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_LAYERED
member.summary: The window is a layered window.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_LAYOUTRTL
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the horizontal origin of the window is on the right edge. Increasing horizontal values advance to the left. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_LEFT
member.summary: The window has generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_LEFTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the left of the client area. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_LTRREADING
member.summary: The window text is displayed using left-to-right reading-order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_MDICHILD
member.summary: The window is an MDI child window.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: A top-level window created with this style does not become the foreground window when the user clicks it.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_NOINHERITLAYOUT
member.summary: The window does not pass its window layout to its child windows.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_NOPARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: A child window created with this style does not send the WM_PARENTNOTIFY message to its parent window when it is created or destroyed.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_NOREDIRECTIONBITMAP
member.summary: The window does not render to a redirection surface. This is for windows that do not have visible content or that use mechanisms other than surfaces to provide their visual.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_PALETTEWINDOW
member.summary: The window is a palette window, which is a modeless dialog box that presents an array of commands.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_RIGHT
member.summary: The window has generic right-aligned properties.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_RIGHTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: The vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_RTLREADING
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment, the window text is displayed using right-to-left reading-order properties. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_STATICEDGE
member.summary: The window has a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW
member.summary: The window is intended to be used as a floating toolbar.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_TOPMOST
member.summary: The window is placed above all non-topmost windows and stays above them, even when the window is deactivated.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: The window is not painted until siblings beneath the window (that were created by the same thread) have been painted.

member.name: F:HP.LFT.SDK.WindowExtendedStyles.WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: The window has a border with a raised edge.
